div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 22:53 pm CDT

div.div: Mostly clear, with a low around 43. Light east southeast wind.

A chance of rain, mainly between 7am and 2pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 65. Light and variable wind becoming west 6 to 11 mph in the morning. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Mostly clear, with a low around 40. West wind 7 to 10 mph.

div.div: Follow Avenue City Elementary PTO on Facebook

span.span: In November of 2019, all Avenue City School eighth grade students completed an essay assignment entitled “Vaping: The New Addiction/Epidemic?” and had the opportunity to submit their essay to the Missouri Peace Officers Association essay contest that provided the topic of vaping. The following students submitted their essay for a panel of ACES staff to select the top three to be sent on to the contest: Saige Blake, Hilarry Elifrits, Lucy Froehlich, Maren Heckman, Alexander Hutchcraft, Macy Keling, Payton Rodgers, Hunter Turner, and Caydence Stains. Saige, Maren, and Macy were the top three selected from ACES to be entered in the contest.

Congrautlations to Saige Blake for winning first place in the 2020 Missouri Peace Officers Association essay contest! Saige earned a total of $500; she received $300, ACES received $100, and her classroom teacher earned $100.
Thank you fo the Missouri Peace Officers Association or inviting our students to participate in this contest and to the students what went the extra mile to enter the contest.

Our 6th-8th gifted class placed in the Stock Market Game for the 3rd year in a row. This year we placed 2nd with a profit of $2316.14. It was a challenging year with an up and down market, but we all learned a lot about investing. Our most profitable stock was Nvidia with a 26.5% return on our investment. Congratulations to our team of Ethan Zeit, Hilarry Elifrits, Alayna Pargas, and Nori Steele!

a.aria-label: Read more about Award Winning Students
Read more about Alternative Instruction Spirit Week

li.span: Cross Categorical Special Education Teacher: 2020-2021 school year. We are looking for a highly qualified, innovative, and motivated teacher. The professional must be able to cooperatively work with others as part of a team, must understand developmental learning levels of all ages, and be willing to work on professional development skills to stay updated on current and effective teaching standards and protocols. Professionals that apply must have knowledge of special education process, paperwork, and assessments; organizational skills that allow that all mandated timelines will be met; and the ability to implement individualized education programs. The teacher must be aware and be able to teach content-core standard, maintain the high quality standards of the district, develop and implement curriculum standards, and be an independent and futuristic thinker. Candidates who are interested in a positive school environment and working with a professional group of educators are highly encouraged to apply.

p.span: Avenue City School is currently growing in number of students, high academically performing school, a Missouri Gold Star School, has been accredited with Distinction in Performance since 1999, and often appears on the Missouri Top 10 School List. Avenue City offers competitive salaries, excellent location, small student/teacher ratio, and a positive learning environment.
This position will be removed when the successful candidate has been identified. Avenue City School District is an equal opportunity employer.
Applications available at phone: 816-662-2305 or email: bgrimes@avenuecityschool.org
Please send completed packet including application, letter of interest, resume and transcript to:
Click here to download and print application: Certified Staff Application

span.span: Para Professional Position for the 2020-2021 school year. We are looking for a highly qualified and motivated para-professional. The para-professional must be able to cooperatively work with others as part of a team, be willing to work on professional development skills to stay updated on current early childhood education strategies, be willing to take directions from certified staff, be patient and understanding with students at all developmental levels, and be able to act with agility to ensure student safety. Priority will be given to applicants who have experience in early childhood / preschool setting. This position is part time
Qualifications: 60 College Hours or Passed the Para Pro Assessment
Avenue City School District offers competitive salaries, excellent location, small student/teacher ratio, and a positive learning environment.
This position will be removed when the successful candidate has been identified. Avenue City School District is an equal opportunity employer.

Applications available at phone: 816-662-2305 or email: bgrimes@avenuecityschool.org
Please send completed packet including application, letter of interest, resume, and transcript to:
Avenue City School
c/o Principal Rebecca Grimes
18068 Highway 169
Click here to download and print application:

a.aria-label: Read more about Apply NOW for Available 2020-2021 Position(s)

span.span: Good evening Avenue City School,

At the press conference today (April 9, 2020) Governor Mike Parson announced that all public and charter school buildings in the state of Missouri will remain closed until the end of the academic school year. The Avenue City School Building is closed, classrooms are empty – but LEARNING IS STILL IN SESSION! The staff at Avenue City School will continue to provide alternative learning opportunities for our students. The learning program will consistent of the virtual program that the dedicated and professional staff has developed over the past three weeks. We appreciate parent and community support during this time – these opportunities could not happen without your cooperation! Thank you so much for all of your help.
More information will be coming to you soon about how long we will continue these alternative learning opportunities.
Have an awesome Spring Break and a blessed Easter.

a.aria-label: Read more about LEARNING IS STILL IN SESSION

h3.a: Missouri Governor Mike Parson Closes Schools

div.p: From Missouri Governor,

We are ordering all Missouri public and charter schools to remain closed through the remainder of the academic year with the exceptions of nutrition services and child care that are outlined in our recent health order.

This recommendation was made by working together with the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education and several school superintendents from across the state -- from both urban and rural districts.
Schools should continue remote learning for their students until the end date previously set on their academic calendars.
Mike Parson:

a.aria-label: Read more about Missouri Governor Mike Parson Closes Schools

h3.a: Featured Books - Read by Staff - Day #14

span.span: Good morning! While you are learning at home, I will be sharing with you a few books read by our own ACES staff.

AND after you listen to these books (maybe more than once) don't forget to sign on to your Accelerated Reader Account and take the quiz- (Don't tell your teachers - but I will allow listening to these books count towards your points!)
Book #26:
Mrs. Bell reads Green Eggs and Ham, by Dr. Seuss. Does Sam like Green Eggs and Ham?

div.p: Book #25: Mrs Wolfe reading Bark, George by Jules Feiffer​​​​​​​​​​​​​​. George the dog tries to figure out what to say.
Book #24; Mrs. Farrell tells a story. Listen to this digital interactive story.

a.span: Mrs. Farrell tells us an interactive story.

span.span: Mrs. Spalding reading Get Well, Good Knight by Shelly Thomas. When three dragons get sick the knight tries to help them recover.
Mrs. Spalding reading Get Well, Good Knight

div.p: Book #22: Mrs. Scott reading Spoon Amy Krouse Rosenthal, a book about us all being special.
Book #21: Mr. Jones reads Goodnight Moon by Margaret Wise Brown. A classic book with a bunny saying "Goodnight" to everything in his room.

Book #20: Mrs. Forney reads How to Get a Girlfriend by Alexander Hald, Leo Dzuver, and Matej Crnogorac. Written by three kindergarten students, this book tells the reader step by step how to get a girlfriend.

a.span: Mrs. Forney reads How to Get a Girlfriend

span.span: Book #19: Mrs. Schaeffer reads Elmer the Patchwork Elephant by David McKee. Elmer is different but finds our everyone likes him that way.

a.span: Mrs. Scaheffer reads Elmer the Patchwork Elephant

div.p: Book #18: Mrs. Wing reads The Loud Book by Deoborah Unerwood. There are lots of quiets and lots of louds!

a.span: Mrs. Wing reads The Loud Book

div.p: Book $17: Mrs. Williams reads Bear, Your Manners ar Showing by Kathleen Allan-Meyer. Mother Bear find a way to help the Baby Bear remember his manners.

a.span: Mrs. Williams reads Bear, Your Manners are Showing

span.span: Book #16: Mrs. Russell reads Rhyming Dust Bunnies by Jan Thomas. These bunnies love to rhyme, except Bob!

div.p: Book #15: Mrs. Sigrist reads Have You Filled a Bucket Today? by Carol McCloud. Learn about giving, sharing, and caring.

a.span: Mrs. Sigrist reads Have You filled a Bucket Today?

span.span: Book #14:
Mrs. Proctor reads Happy Birthday to You, You Belong in a Zoo! by Diana De Groat. Are you celebrating your birthday? This is a great book for you.

a.span: Mrs. Proctor -Happy Birthday to You, You Belong in the Zoo!

div.p: Book #13: Mrs. Rowland reads Alexander and the No Good, Terrible, Horrible, Very Bad Day by judith Viorst. Everything goes wrong for Alexander, but some days are like that.

a.span: Mrs. Rowland - Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day

div.p: Book #12: Mrs. Pargas reads The Day the Crayons Came Home by Drew Daywalt. The Crayons are scattered all over the world and in Duncan's house.

a.span: Mrs. Pargas reads The Day the Crayons Came Home

div.p: Book #11: Mrs. Ordnung reads There is a Monster in you Book by Tom Fletcher. Look out, there is a monster in this book!

a.span: Mrs. Ordnung - There is a Monster in Your Book

span.span: Book#10: Mrs. Lesh reads Burger Boy by Alan Durant. This is a book about a boy who only likes burgers and one day he turns into a burger.

div.p: Book #9: Mrs. Hoffman reads The Wide Mouth Frog by Keith Faulkner,​​​​​​. The frog is very interested in the eating habits of others until he meets someone who thinks he would taste delicious!
Book #8: Mrs. Froehlich reads Bark George. George, a dog, cannot figure out what he is supposed to say.
Book #7: Mrs. Grimes reads Mortimer by Robert Munsch. This was my son's favorite book when he was little. This book is about a little boy who would much rather sing his rowdy song than go to sleep.
Book #6: Book #6: Mrs. Ellis reads No, David! A fun book about a five year old boy who gets into mischief. This is one of my favorite books!!
Book #5: Book #5: Mrs. Davis reads Library Mouse. This is a story about a little mouse that lives in the reference section of a library.

span.span: Book #4: Mrs. Atoe will be reading We Don't Eat Our Classmates by Ryan T. Higgins. This is about the first day of school of a tiny t-rex dinosaur.

a.span: Mrs. Atoe - We Don't Eat our Classmates

div.p: Book #3: Mrs. Atchity will be reading Tacky the Penguin by Helen Lester. Tacky is an odd bird who marches to his own beat but the other penguins find out he is a good bird to have around.

span.span: Book #2 is titled UNDERWEAR! by Jenn Harney. Mrs. Svendsen and her son Grayson will be reading this funny book about a little bear and his underwear!
Book #1 is titled Where the Wild Things Are by Maurice Sendak. Below is the link for you to watch Superintendent Lawrence read that book - this is one of his favorites!

a.span: Superintendent Lawrence - Where the Wild Things Are

span.span: Happy Listening!
Mrs. Grimes

span.span: Are your kids bored already? Have they already read every book in the house? Do they need something new to read for Spring Summer!
Well the Avenue City School District Book Fair is for you!
You can order books ONLINE and they will be delivered to your house, TO YOUR HOME!
Every purchase will help the ACES School Library!

h3.a: Free / Reduced Meals for Your Child(ren)

div.p: The Coronavirus pandemic has caused unlimited hardships on our families at Avenue City School, across the Untied States, and around the entire world. Have you recently lost employment or income because of this pandemic? One way we can help is free/reduced meals for student(s). If this application is approved, other opportunities might also become available for your family. Please print and fill out the attached Free/Reduced Meal Application. You can mail the application to Avenue City School or email the completed application to Mrs. Ordnung.
Email: (bordnung@avenuecityschool.org)
Avenue City School
18069 Highway 169
Cosby, Mo 64436
CLICK BELOW FOR MORE INFORMATION

div.p:
Avenue City Preschool
We offer Preschool for 3,4 and 5 year olds on M-W-F from 8:00 am-3:00 pm with an half day option. Afterschool childcare is also available starting at 3:00 pm until 5:45pm.
Did you know that you do not need to live in our school district to attend our Preschool? However, first priority will be given to district patrons who attend all day. We are taking applications beginning February 3, 2020 for the 2020-2021 school year. Space is limited.
Avenue City Preschool has many things to offer your child that you may not find in other Preschools.
We use the Pathways to Reading Phonics Program. There will be separate lessons for the 3 year olds and the 4 and 5 year olds so that we can meet their different developmental needs. We . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Preschool at ACES!
